byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and VIVIAN YEE

abstract: Former United States Sen Alfonse M D’Amato takes witness stand in federal corruption trial of Dean G Skelos, former majority leader of New York Senate, and his son Adam B Skelos, testifying that he warned elder Skelos of his son's troublesome behavior at medical malpractice insurance company Physicians’ Reciprocal Insurers; forceful yet matter-of-fact testimony bolsters testimony of other witnesses, who claim that Sen Skelos used his influence to help his son professionally.
lead_paragraph: Mr. D’Amato, a former United States senator, took a star turn at the federal corruption trial of a fellow Republican, State Senator Dean G. Skelos, and his son, Adam B. Skelos.

headline.main: Alfonse D’Amato in Rare Role: Testifying Against Friend at Skelos Trial
headline.print_headline: D’Amato in Rare Role: Testifying Against Friend

snippet: Mr. D’Amato, a former United States senator, took a star turn at the federal corruption trial of a fellow Republican, State Senator Dean G. Skelos, and his son, Adam B. Skelos.
